page.title: 09The Churches of Weston
page.content:
The Church of St Mary the Virgin dates from the 11th Century or earlier. At the instigation of the Norreys Bertie family, a new church was built on the site of the previous nave in 1742 and this was in turn extensively restored in the 19th Century. Â£3000 was raised this century to repair the organ. The church has many interesting features including a 12th Century font, an iron cross from a ship in the Spanish Arma- da and an altar painting attributed to Bettoni. Many tombstones in the well kept churchyard bear witness to the longevity of previous parishioners.
Weston Methodist Chapel is one of the oldest in the area. It was built circa 1834 by community effort on one of the last plots of freehold land remaining after Enclosure. It was extended in the 1930s and again in the 1970s.
